sub_concepts.name: Cosmic Microwave Background Radiation
sub_concepts.definition: The residual heat from the Big Bang, now cooled to a few degrees above absolute zero.

sub_concepts.name: Expanding Universe
sub_concepts.definition: The observation that the universe is not static, but instead is expanding.

sub_concepts.name: Inflationary Universe
sub_concepts.definition: A period of extremely rapid expansion of the universe during its early stages.

sub_concepts.name: Hubble's Law
sub_concepts.definition: The observation that the speed at which a galaxy is moving away from us is proportional to its distance from us.

sub_concepts.name: Redshift
sub_concepts.definition: The shifting of light towards longer, redder wavelengths as it travels through an expanding universe.

sub_concepts.name: Nucleosynthesis
sub_concepts.definition: The process by which the lightest elements (hydrogen, helium, and lithium) were formed in the early universe.
